intro: Sticherus umbraculifer, commonly known as the shadow fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Hymenophyllaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, intricate fronds that are often covered in fine, silky hairs. This plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest undergrowth or on rocky surfaces. Its reproductive structures, known as sori, are clustered on the underside of its fronds. Sticherus umbraculifer is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in high humidity and partial shade.
